description: Diminutive of Old French timbre, from Latin tympanum.

entries.meaning: An ancient percussion instrument rather like a simple tambourine.
examples: Hence the soft couch, and many-colour'd robe,The timbrel and arch'd dome and costly feast,With all th' inventive arts that nurse the soulTo forms of beauty  […]

verbs.description: timbrel (third-person singular simple present timbrels, present participle timbrelling or timbreling, simple past and past participle timbrelled or timbreled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To accompany with the sound of the timbrel.
examples: Yet there the timbrelled hymn / Rings to Osiris  […]
